definition: to put on a hat/to be first/to dub
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)

sentences.english: Local media and netizens have hence nicknamed Liu a "nisemusume" or "pseudo girl.
sentences.chinese: 在那之後，他被當地媒體和網民冠以“僞娘”稱號。

sentences.english: The crown is decorated with a stunning black onyx cabochon.
sentences.chinese: 錶冠以一顆華麗的凸圓形黑縞瑪瑙裝飾。

sentences.english: People who are perceived as experts have a greater ability to persuade others.
sentences.chinese: 被冠以專家名號的人物在說服他人方面確實技高一籌。

sentences.english: A woman, after marriage, usually drops her surname and takes that of her husband.
sentences.chinese: 女人在婚後往往去掉自己的姓氏而冠以夫姓。

sentences.english: We know these parallel-operating wholes by different names.
sentences.chinese: 我們給這些並行進程冠以各種名稱。

sentences.english: This building in New York's Columbus Circle is dubbed the 'lollipop' building for obvious reasons.
sentences.chinese: 這個建築被冠以“棒棒糖”的名號是有原因的。

sentences.english: The socialists brand us with the name individualist.
sentences.chinese: 社會者冠以我們“個人主義者”之名。

sentences.english: Already, she has been dubbed "Die Robin Hood Bankerin".
sentences.chinese: 她已經被冠以“銀行家中的女羅賓漢”稱號。

sentences.english: “SEA of peace” is the title China has bestowed on its adjacent oceans.
sentences.chinese: 中國給其周邊海域冠以“和平之海”的名號。

sentences.english: It is where hypocrisy first gained a bad name.
sentences.chinese: 它是一個“僞善”會被第一時間冠以壞名聲的地方。

sentences.english: I have henceforth the privilege of adding to my name the honourable title of a double S.
sentences.chinese: 我今後在我的姓名上便有冠以雙S的名譽銜頭了。

sentences.english: Tianning Temple gained far-flung fame because of this, and. was given the honor of one of Four Famous Temples in Central Plains.
sentences.chinese: 天寧寺由此名聲遠播，被冠以中原四大名寺之一。

sentences.english: Historically, it has always been the individual who is accused of betraying his country.
sentences.chinese: 從古至今，一向是個人被冠以背叛國家之名。

sentences.english: The photo ran under the headline 'Excuse me Condi, can I go to the bathroom?
sentences.chinese: 照片被冠以“抱歉，賴斯，我能去廁所嗎？”

definition: called/to call sth (by a name)/to name
to be called/to be known as
to be known as/to be nicknamed/to be purportedly/to claim (often exaggeratedly or falsely)
to give a name to/to dub/to christen/to designate/named after/naming
alternative name/to refer to sth by another name/antonomasia
to achieve fame among one's contemporaries (idiom); temporary or local celebrity
person (first person, second person etc in grammar)/called/known as
